channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024050428
item.description:
Report X-2024050428

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: PARSIPPANY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. PACKAGE WAS A ULINE INSULATED SHIPPER BOX PREPRINTED RUSH, PERISHABLE INSULATED WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FOUR POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING WHAT APPEARS TO BE A FOOD PRODUCT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NEW JERSEY USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 015EX7, THE UPS STORE #1611, 163 E MAIN ST, LITTLE FALLS NJ 07424-1711.

item.title: Report X-2024050335
item.description:
Report X-2024050335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-06
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage in a bag with suspicions of internal leakage. Upon inspection, suspicion was confirmed by a semi sealed lid on the drum containing paint. Lid attachments weren't fully tighten on to the drum causing a slight escape area. Paint spilled and soiled drum, drying up all around the lid opening. Most of leakage was contained by a plastic bag that drum was placed in to be shipped out, slight paint did escape and soiled the inner & outer packaging box. Drum was placed into a salvage drum to await disposition from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2024050293
item.description:
Report X-2024050293

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-03
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 4X1GALLON (PLASTIC BOTTLES) QUALITY CHEMICAL DENATURED ALCOHOL (ETHANOL) CAP ALL 4 BOTTLES WERE TURNED DOWN AND CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 20% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024050297
item.description:
Report X-2024050297

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024050297 DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE BOTTLE OF B RAPICIDE WAS FOUND WITH THE CAP OFF THAT CAUSED THE PACKAGE TO BE DAMAGED. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. 2. X-2024050300 attachment Name:image2 (1).jpeg
